name: 施岳廷
objective: This course aims to teach students the fundamental knowledge of ceramic materials used for thermal and/or mechanical application. It will start from a quick review of ceramic materials and ceramic processing. Afterward, important concepts of the thermal and mechanical properties of ceramics will be discussed.
schedule:
1. Review of ceramic materials
2. Review of ceramic processing
3. Heat capacity and thermal conductivity
4. Thermal expansion
5. Overview of mechanical properties of ceramics
6. Elasticity
7. Fracture
8. Strength and toughness
9. Crack growth
10. Permanent deformation
11. Thermal and Compositional Stresses
12. Measurement Techniques and Fractography
scorePolicy:
Final report (oral presentation) 30%
Final exam 50%
Quiz 20%
materials:
1.	W. D. Kingery, H. K. Bowen and D. R. Uhlmann, Introduction to Ceramics. (Wiley, 1976).
2.	M. Barsoum and M. W. Barsoum, Fundamentals of Ceramics. (Taylor & Francis, 2002).
3.	J. B. Wachtman, W. R. Cannon and M. J. Matthewson, Mechanical Properties of Ceramics. (Wiley, 2009).
